data.title: Descendants of Judel (Yudel) KNOPFLMACHER
data.text: Descendants of Judel (Yudel) KNOPFLMACHER Generation No. 1 1. Judel (Yudel) 1 KNOPFLMACHER was born Abt. 1645 in Leipnik, Moravia. He married (unknown). Notes for Judel (Yudel) KNOPFLMACHER: Rabbi Judel Knopflmacher likely resided in the ancient town of Leipnik, Moravia. In the Knopflmacher Family Stammbaum, he is referred to as "our teacher, Rabbi Yudel". No further information about him is known. Child of Judel KNOPFLMACHER and (unknown) is: + 2 i. Joachim (Chaim) 2 KNOPFLMACHER, born Abt. 1672 in Leipnik, Moravia; died Bet. 1753 - 1764. Generation No. 2 2. Joachim (Chaim) 2 KNOPFLMACHER (Judel (Yudel) 1 ) was born Abt. 1672 in Leipnik, Moravia, and died Bet. 1753 - 1764. He married (unknown). She was born Abt. 1678. Notes for Joachim (Chaim) KNOPFLMACHER: According to the Knopflmacher Family Stammbaum, Joachim was a Rabbi in Leipnik, Moravia. He is referred to as "our teacher, Rabbi Chaim". Joachim's name has been also established through a Holesov document, dated 18 June 1794, in which his son Moises is alternately referred to as "Moises Knopflmacher", "Moises [b.] JOACHIM", and "Moises [b.] JOACHIM Leipniker". This third variation is evidence that Joachim Knopflmacher was a resident of Leipnik, Moravia [now Lipnik nad Becvou, Czech Republic]. Rabbi Joachim Knopflmacher was still alive in 1753 but was deceased by 1764 when a great-grandson was named in his honor. Children of Joachim KNOPFLMACHER and (unknown) are: + 3 i. Jacob 3 KNOPFLMACHER, born Abt. 1700 in Leipnik, Moravia; died Bef. 1739 in Moravia. 4 ii. Taltze KNOPFLMACHER, born Abt. 1703 in Leipnik, Moravia. She married Wolf. Notes for Taltze KNOPFLMACHER: According to the Knopflmacher Family Stammbaum, Taltze was "bethrothed to Wolf, son of our teacher, Mordechai" 5 iii. Chayale KNOPFLMACHER, born Abt. 1706 in Leipnik, Moravia. Notes for Chayale KNOPFLMACHER: In the Knopflmacher Family Stammbaum, Chayale is referred to as "the daughter of Chaim of blessed memory".
